In the `CP4WAIOPS` "Hamburger" Menu select `Define`/`Data and tool connections` 1. Click `Add connection` 1. Under `Ansible Automation Controller`, click on `Add connection` 1. Click `Connect` 1. üîé Get the data from your configuration file `MY_CONFIGURATION.txt` - section **2.3 Configure Runbooks - Ansible Automation Controller** ```bash ./tools/11_practicum/get_configuration_info.sh > MY_CONFIGURATION.txt ``` 1. Fill out the fields: ![image](./../images/29_runbook.png) ```yaml URL for REST API: from MY_CONFIGURATION.txt Authentication type: User ID/Password User: admin Password: from MY_CONFIGURATION.txt 1. Click `Done` 1. Make sure that the Connection Status turn green after a few seconds ## Check integration 1. In the `CP4WAIOPS` "Hamburger" Menu select `Operate`/`Automations` 1. Select tab `Actions` 1. Verify that the Ansible Playbooks have been imported ![image](./../images/30_runbook.png) ## üöÄ TASK: Create a runbook üåè Documentation for the Task: Creating a runbook Create a Runbook based on the `CP4WAIOPS Mitigate Robotshop Ratings Outage` Ansible Playbook. üîé The parameters can also be found in your configuration file `MY_CONFIGURATION.txt` - section `2.4 Configure Runbooks - Runbook Parameters` 1. Select tab `Runbooks` 1. Click `Create Runbook` 1. Name it `RobotShop Mitigate MySQL Problem` 1. Click `Add automated step` 1. Select `CP4WAIOPS Mitigate Robotshop Ratings Outage` 1. Click `Select this action` 1. Click `Mapping` / `Select` 1. Select `New runbook parameter` ![image](./../images/31_runbook.png) 1. Select tab 1. üîé Get the data from your configuration file `MY_CONFIGURATION.txt` - section `2.4 Configure Runbooks - Runbook Parameters` ```bash ./tools/11_practicum/get_configuration_info.sh > MY_CONFIGURATION.txt ``` ![image](./../images/32_runbook.png) 1. Replace `PROVIDE: my_k8s_apiurl and my_k8s_apikey` in field `Default value (optional)` with the **üó∫Ô∏è Value** from the script 1. Click `Save` 1. Click `Save` again 1. Click `Actions` and `Publish`
